intro: Mycaranthes leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired mycaranthes, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its tufted, wiry stems and small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine, white hairs, giving it its common name. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
